basics.name: Alexandre Beaubien
basics.label: PhD Candidate in Experimental High Energy Particle Physics
basics.summary: PhD candidate at University of Victoria working with the Belle II experiment. Experienced in data analysis, detector calibration, and machine learning applications for high energy Physics.

work.name: University of Victoria
work.position: PhD Candidate, Experimental High Energy Particle Physics
work.summary: Research with Belle II collaboration including cross section measurements, development of a polarized electron source for future SuperKEKB upgrades, and GEANT4 geometry design.
highlights: Measured electron-positron to two-pion cross section
Developed event-level b-quark and c-quark classifier
Designed new GEANT4 geometries for ECL and support structures

work.name: University of Victoria
work.position: MSc Researcher, Experimental High Energy Physics
work.summary: Developed pulse shape discrimination tools, noise waveform generators using CNN-GANs, and machine learning based particle identification tools for the Belle II calorimeter.
highlights: Calibrated ECL pulse shape discrimination tool
Created background noise generator using CNN-GANs

work.name: SNOLAB
work.summary: Calibrated high purity germanium detector, performed data taking with calibration sources, and simulated detector response with GEANT4.
highlights: Completed calibration under Dr. Silvia Scorza, Dr. Ian Lawson, Dr. Bruce Cleveland
Performed data analysis using ROOT and C++

work.name: McGill University
work.summary: Investigated background sources and rates in Belle II detector using first collision data and simulations under Prof. Andreas Warburton.
highlights: Presented results at McGill undergraduate poster conference

work.name: University of Victoria
work.summary: Delivered tutorials and laboratory experiment courses for undergraduate physics courses.
highlights: Prepared and delivered tutorials and labs
Marked lab reports and taught scientific writing

work.name: KEK, Tsukuba, Japan
work.summary: Operated Belle II detector onsite, troubleshot operational issues, verified data acquisition, and served as ECL sub-system expert.

volunteer.organization: Physics and Astronomy Graduate Student Association, University of Victoria
volunteer.summary: Lead association for student representation within the department, academic and social event organization, grant applications, and financial management.
Organized and presented scientific experiments to children.
Provided personalized tutoring in mathematics and English as a second language.
Assisted high school students in all subjects across grade levels.

awards.title: KEK-TRIUMF Exchange Program for Early Career Researchers

references.name: Professor Michael Roney
references.reference: MSc/PhD advisor, Department of Physics and Astronomy, University of Victoria. Email: mroney@uvic.ca

references.name: Professor Robert Kowalewski
references.reference: MSc/PhD committee member, Department of Physics and Astronomy, University of Victoria. Email: kowalews@uvic.ca
